President Hamid leaving for S. Africa Monday

President Abdul Hamid will leave Dhaka for Durban tomorrow, Monday, to attend the funeral of the undisputed leader Nelson Mandela, told Foreign Ministry sources today.

Observers of present political situation in Bangladesh are worried when President is leaving the country so early amid the country’s evolving political situation.

Nelson Mandela will be laid to rest on the December 15 in Qunu in the Eastern Cape province.

President Hamid might be first chiep of stat to reache there to attend the funeral ceremony to be held on December 11. World leaders are expected to join the funeral ceremony. U.S. President Barack Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama will attend the funeral ceremony.

South Africa’s state broadcasting company SABC said, Mandela’s body was taken to a military hospital in Pretoria and will be there for three days till December 11.

Former South African President Nelson Mandela died at his Johannesburg home on Thursday after a prolonged lung infection.

Bangladesh has expressed solidarity and has called for three days of mourning.

Mandela visited Dhaka in March 1997 to celebrate Bangladesh’s 25th year of independence.

At the time, he was the president of South Africa.
